body:
## What's Changed
* fix: double quotes around release url by @j-zimnowoda in https://github.com/noqcks/gucci/pull/48
* Restore env and expandenv. by @mck-iain in https://github.com/noqcks/gucci/pull/46
* Upgrade to go v1.17 and install gingko v2 by @noqcks in https://github.com/noqcks/gucci/pull/49

## New Contributors
* @j-zimnowoda made their first contribution in https://github.com/noqcks/gucci/pull/48
* @mck-iain made their first contribution in https://github.com/noqcks/gucci/pull/46

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/noqcks/gucci/compare/1.5.5...1.6.5

## Changelog
* 70367aa Remove LICENSE shield image
* 1c7800b bump patch version (#44)
* 4a5d232 rename ci jobs (#43)
* d309407 shell, stdout in error details; added ci action (#41)

## Changelog
* fa23c17 increment patch version
* c8feece use go 1.16

## Changelog

* 1c9c3b2 arm64 support
* 1723031 implement 'include' template function (#38)
* d3593a0 version 1.5.1

## Changelog

3d2c3ab Create FUNDING.yml
f1be417 Update sprig v3.1.0 -> v3.2.2 (#35)
2ba44cd fetch depth 0
1d55393 go release
d73b046 goarch
e5c154e goreleaser
5f6d7c3 update format
2eae97c update goreleaser
d9f5c2e update goreleaser
3866361 update readme and goreleaser

- Inputs from JSON and YAML files accepted
- Base64 encode function -> `b64enc` 
- Now testing using ginkgo for better testing output
- Additional integration tests added

name: v0.0.3
body: - Allowing ENV vars inside of shell command

name: v0.0.2
body: - Adding `shell` function to execute arbitrary shell commands inside a template

name: v0.0.1
body: This is the initial release for gucci, a cli templating tool.
